etymologies: Old English settan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zetten, German setzen, also to sit

notes.text: Set, meaning ‘place or put,’ is mainly a transitive verb and takes a direct object: set the flowers on top of the piano. Sit, meaning ‘be seated,’ is mainly intransitive and does not take a direct object: sit in this chair while I check the light meter

definitions: put, lay, or stand (something) in a specified place or position

examples.text: Dana set the mug of tea down
Catherine set a chair by the bed

notes.text: with object and usually with adverbial

shortDefinitions: put, lay, or stand something in specified place or position

definitions: be situated or fixed in a specified place or position

examples.text: the village was set among olive groves on a hill

shortDefinitions: be situated or fixed in specified place or position

definitions: represent (a story, play, movie, or scene) as happening at a specified time or in a specified place

examples.text: a spy novel set in Berlin

shortDefinitions: represent story, play, film, or scene as happening at specified time

definitions: mount a precious stone in (something, typically a piece of jewelry)

examples.text: a bracelet set with emeralds

shortDefinitions: mount precious stone in

definitions: mount (a precious stone) in something

examples.text: a huge square-cut emerald set in platinum

shortDefinitions: mount precious stone in something

definitions: arrange (type) as required

examples.text: the compositors refused to set the type for an editorial

shortDefinitions: arrange type as required

definitions: arrange the type for (a piece of text)

examples.text: article headings will be set in Times fourteen point

shortDefinitions: arrange type for

definitions: prepare (a table) for a meal by placing cutlery, dishes, etc., on it in their proper places

examples.text: she set the table and began breakfast

shortDefinitions: prepare table for meal by placing cutlery

definitions: cause (a hen) to sit on eggs

examples.text: you had to set the clucking hens

shortDefinitions: cause hen to sit on eggs

definitions: put (a seed or plant) in the ground to grow

examples.text: I set the plants in shallow hollows to facilitate watering

shortDefinitions: put seed or plant in ground to grow

definitions: put (a sail) up in position to catch the wind

examples.text: a safe distance from shore all sails were set

shortDefinitions: put sail up in position to catch wind

definitions: put or bring into a specified state

examples.text: the hostages were set free
plunging oil prices set in motion an economic collapse in Houston

notes.text: with object and usually with adverbial

shortDefinitions: put or bring into specified state

definitions: cause (someone or something) to start doing something

examples.text: the incident set me thinking

shortDefinitions: cause person or thing to start doing something

definitions: instruct (someone) to do something

examples.text: he'll set a man to watch you

shortDefinitions: instruct someone to do something

definitions: give someone (a task)

examples.text: the problem we have been set

shortDefinitions: give someone task or test to do

definitions: devise (a test) and give it to someone to do.
shortDefinitions: devise test and give it to someone to do

definitions: establish as (an example) for others to follow, copy, or try to achieve

examples.text: the scheme sets a precedent for other companies

shortDefinitions: establish as example for others to follow, copy, or try to achieve

definitions: establish (a record)

examples.text: his time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record

shortDefinitions: establish

definitions: decide on

examples.text: they set a date for a full hearing at the end of February

shortDefinitions: decide on and announce

definitions: fix (a price, value, or limit) on something

examples.text: the unions had set a limit on the size of the temporary workforce

shortDefinitions: fix price, value, or limit on something

definitions: adjust (a clock or watch), typically to show the right time

examples.text: set your watch immediately to local time at your destination
to revert to an old style would be to try to set back the clock and deny the progress which had been made

shortDefinitions: adjust clock or watch

definitions: adjust (an alarm clock) to sound at the required time

examples.text: I usually set my alarm clock for eight

shortDefinitions: adjust alarm clock to sound at required time

definitions: adjust (a device or its controls) so that it performs a particular operation

examples.text: you have to be careful not to set the volume too high

shortDefinitions: adjust device so that it performs particular operation

definitions: cause (a binary device) to enter the state representing the numeral 1.
shortDefinitions: cause binary device to enter state representing numeral 1

definitions: harden into a solid or semisolid state

examples.text: cook for a further thirty-five minutes until the filling has set

shortDefinitions: harden into solid or semi-solid state

definitions: arrange (the hair) while damp so that it dries in the required style

examples.text: she had set her hair on small rollers

shortDefinitions: arrange hair while damp so that it dries in required style

definitions: put parts of (a broken or dislocated bone or limb) into the correct position for healing

examples.text: he lined up the bones and set the arm

shortDefinitions: put parts of into correct position for healing

definitions: (of a bone) be restored to its normal condition by knitting together again after being broken

examples.text: dogs' bones soon set

shortDefinitions: (of bone) be restored to its normal condition by knitting together again after being broken

definitions: (with reference to a person's face) assume or cause to assume a fixed or rigid expression

examples.text: her features never set into a civil parade of attention
Travis's face was set as he looked up

shortDefinitions: assume or cause to assume fixed or rigid expression

definitions: (of the eyes) become fixed in position or in the feeling they are expressing

examples.text: his bright eyes set in an expression of mocking amusement

shortDefinitions: (of eyes) become fixed in position or in feeling they are expressing

definitions: (of a hunting dog) adopt a rigid attitude indicating the presence of game.
shortDefinitions: (of hunting dog) adopt rigid attitude indicating presence of game

definitions: (of the sun, moon, or another celestial body) appear to move toward and below the earth's horizon as the earth rotates

examples.text: the sun was setting and a warm red glow filled the sky

shortDefinitions: (of sun, moon, or another celestial body) appear to move towards and below earth's horizon as earth rotates

definitions: (of a tide or current) take or have a specified direction or course

examples.text: a fair tide can be carried well past Land's End before the stream sets to the north

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: (of tide or current) take or have specified direction or course

definitions: start (a fire)

examples.text: the school had been broken into and the fire had been set

shortDefinitions: start

definitions: (of blossom or a tree) develop into or produce (fruit)

examples.text: wait until first flowers have set fruit before planting out the peppers

shortDefinitions: (of blossom or tree) form into or produce

definitions: (of fruit) develop from blossom

examples.text: once fruits have set, feed weekly with a high potash liquid tomato fertilizer

shortDefinitions: (of fruit) develop from blossom

definitions: (of a plant) produce (seed)

examples.text: the herb has flowered and started to set seed

shortDefinitions: (of plant) produce

definitions: sit

examples.text: a perfect lady—just set in her seat and stared

shortDefinitions: sit

etymologies: late Middle English: partly from Old French sette, from Latin secta ‘sect’, partly from set

definitions: a group or collection of things that belong together or resemble one another or are usually found together

examples.text: a set of false teeth
a new cell with two sets of chromosomes
a spare set of clothes

shortDefinitions: group or collection of things that belong together or resemble one another or are usually found together

definitions: a collection of implements, containers, or other objects customarily used together for a specific purpose

examples.text: an electric fondue set

shortDefinitions: collection of implements, containers, or other objects customarily used together

definitions: a group of people with common interests or occupations or of similar social status

examples.text: it was a fashionable haunt of the literary set

shortDefinitions: group of people with common interests or occupations

definitions: (in tennis, darts, and other games) a group of games counting as a unit toward a match, only the player or side that wins a defined number or proportion of the games being awarded a point toward the final score

examples.text: he took the first set 6-3

shortDefinitions: (in games) group of games counting as unit towards match

definitions: (in jazz or popular music) a sequence of songs or pieces performed together and constituting or forming part of a live show or recording

examples.text: a short four-song set

shortDefinitions: (in jazz or popular music) sequence of songs or pieces performed together and constituting or forming part of live show or recording

definitions: a group of people making up the required number for a square dance or similar country dance.
shortDefinitions: group of people making up required number for square dance

definitions: a fixed number of repetitions of a particular bodybuilding exercise

examples.text: making sure that you perform 3 sets of at least 8 repetitions

shortDefinitions: fixed number of repetitions of particular bodybuilding exercise

definitions: a collection of distinct entities regarded as a unit, being either individually specified or (more usually) satisfying specified conditions

examples.text: the set of all positive integers

shortDefinitions: collection of distinct entities regarded as unit, being either individually specified or more

definitions: the way in which something is set, disposed, or positioned

examples.text: the shape and set of the eyes

shortDefinitions: way in which something is set or positioned

definitions: the posture or attitude of a part of the body, typically in relation to the impression this gives of a person's feelings or intentions

examples.text: the determined set of her upper torso

shortDefinitions: posture or attitude of part of body

definitions: the flow of a current or tide in a particular direction

examples.text: the rudder kept the dinghy straight against the set of the tide

shortDefinitions: flow of current or tide in particular direction

definitions: a setter's pointing in the presence of game.
shortDefinitions: setter's pointing in presence of game

definitions: the alternating outward inclinations of the teeth of a saw.
shortDefinitions: inclination of teeth of saw in alternate directions

definitions: a warp or bend in wood, metal, or another material caused by continued strain or pressure.
shortDefinitions: warp or bend in wood, metal, or another material caused by continued strain

definitions: a radio or television receiver

examples.text: a TV set

shortDefinitions: radio or television receiver

definitions: a collection of scenery, stage furniture, and other articles used for a particular scene in a play or film.
shortDefinitions: collection of scenery, stage furniture

definitions: the place or area in which filming is taking place or a play is performed

examples.text: the magazine has interviews on set with top directors

shortDefinitions: place or area in which filming is taking place or play is performed

definitions: an arrangement of the hair when damp so that it dries in the required style

examples.text: a shampoo and set

shortDefinitions: arrangement of hair when damp so that it dries in required style

definitions: a cutting, young plant, or bulb used in the propagation of new plants.
shortDefinitions: cutting, young plant, or bulb used in propagation of new plants

definitions: a young fruit that has just formed.
shortDefinitions: young fruit that has just formed

definitions: the last coat of plaster on a wall.
shortDefinitions: last coat of plaster on wall

definitions: the amount of spacing in type controlling the distance between letters.
shortDefinitions: amount of spacing in type controlling distance between letters

definitions: the width of a piece of type.
shortDefinitions: width of piece of type

etymologies: late Old English, past participle of set

definitions: fixed or arranged in advance

examples.text: there is no set procedure

shortDefinitions: fixed or arranged in advance

definitions: (of a view or habit) unlikely to change

examples.text: I've been on my own a long time and I'm rather set in my ways

shortDefinitions: unlikely to change

definitions: (of a person's expression) held for an unnaturally long time without changing, typically as a reflection of determination

examples.text: Iris was staring in front of her with a set expression

shortDefinitions: held for unnaturally long time without changing

definitions: (of a meal or menu in a restaurant) offered at a fixed price with a limited choice of dishes

examples.text: a three-course set menu

shortDefinitions: (of meal or menu in restaurant) offered at fixed price with limited choice of dishes

definitions: having a conventional or predetermined wording; formulaic

examples.text: witnesses often delivered their testimony according to a set speech

shortDefinitions: having conventional or predetermined wording

definitions: ready, prepared, or likely to do something

examples.text: the first family was set for a quiet night of rest
both are all set to get married
water costs look set to increase

shortDefinitions: ready, prepared, or likely to do something

definitions: firmly opposed to

examples.text: an approach set against tradition and authority

shortDefinitions: firmly opposed to

definitions: determined to do (something)

examples.text: he's set on marrying that girl

shortDefinitions: determined to do
